author: sproul
content:
You can search this server for previous discussions, but my feel on this is that it's unlikely to happen because it's technically subtle and there's not enough momentum behind it (it's not worth upending multiple client teams for a handful of validators). If someone wrote a detailed, well-thought-out proposal (an EIP) and championed it, it might happen. AFAIK there's nobody working on that.

Your best bet might be to slash yourself with another validator, which would get you back a small fraction of the reward (1/512th of the effective balance, in your case around 2 ETH), burn a bit (around 1 ETH/validator, or 30 ETH), and give the rest to the attacker. Or if you're feeling spiteful you could just stop validating and let the validators leak to 16 ETH so that the attacker doesn't get too much.

author: sproul
content: Or, seeing as you've got ~$2m on the line, you could try to hire someone technical to help you with writing an EIP. But success with that strategy is not guaranteed, as Eth governance is a slow-moving beast.
